snippet: Two trailers in a wealthy town stand as testament to an increasingly intractable problem for localities across the country: where to let sex offenders live after prison.
abstract: Cramped trailers housing about 40 sex offenders in wealthy beach town of Southampton, NY, are testament to increasingly intractable problem for localities across country--where to let sex offenders live after they leave prison; Suffolk County is one of many jurisdictions that has passed laws barring convicted sex offenders from living near schools, day care centers, and other places where children gather.
lead_paragraph: Two trailers in a wealthy town stand as testament to an increasingly intractable problem for localities across the country: where to let sex offenders live after prison.

headline.seo: Suffolk County Still Struggling to House Sex Offenders
headline.main: In 2 Trailers, the Neighbors Nobody Wants
headline.print_headline: In 2 Trailers, The Neighbors Nobody Wants
